englishTranslationText: And	made	several	preparations	for	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	maiñ	ne	uske	liye	tarah	tarah	ki	tayyāriyañ	keeiñ

englishTranslationText: Yet	he	desires	that	I	should	give	more.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	yeh	tama'	karta	hai	ke	maiñ	aur	ziyāda	dooñ

englishTranslationText: Never!	For	he	is	an	enemy	to	Our	signs!
romanUrduTranslationText: Hargiz	nahi	woh	to	meri	Āayatoñ	se	'inād	rakhta	hai

englishTranslationText: Soon	I	shall	mount	him	on	Saood,	the	hill	of	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Qareeb	hai	ke	maiñ	usey	āag	ke	pahād	Sa'ood	par	chadhāoñ.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	he	thought,	and	inwardly	decided.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		woh	socha	aur	dil	meiñ	kuchh	bāt	
thehrayi.

englishTranslationText:
So	accursed	be	he,	how	evilly	did	he	
decide!
romanUrduTranslationText: To	us	par	l’anat	ho	kaisi	thehrayi.

englishTranslationText:
Again	accursed	be	he,	how	evilly	did	he	
decide!
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	us	par	l’anat	ho	kaisi	thehrayi.

englishTranslationText: He	then	dared	to	lift	his	gaze.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	nazar	utha	kar	dekha.

englishTranslationText: Then	frowned	and	grimaced.		.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	tewri	chardhayi	(Māthey	par	bal	dāle)	
aur	muñh	bigāda.

englishTranslationText: Then	he	turned	away,	and	was	haughty.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	peeth	pheri	aur	takabbur	kiya.

arabicText: فَقَالَ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌۭ يُؤْثَرُ
englishTranslationText:
And	said,	“This	is	nothing	but	magic	learnt	
from	earlier	men.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	bola	yeh	to	wohi	jādu	hai	agloñ	se	
seekha.

englishTranslationText: “This	is	nothing	but	the	speech	of	a	man.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Yeh	nahi	magar	ādmi	ka	kalām	koi	dam	jāta	
hai	.

englishTranslationText: I	will	soon	fling	him	into	hell.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	maiñ	usey	dozakh	meiñ dhañsāta	hooñ.

englishTranslationText:
And	what	have	you	understood,	what	hell	
is!
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tum	ne	kya	jāna	dozakh	kya	hai?

englishTranslationText: It	neither	leaves,	nor	spares.
romanUrduTranslationText: Na	chhorde	na	lagi	rakhe

englishTranslationText: It	strips	away	the	hide	of	man.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ādmi	ki	khāl	utār	leti	hai

englishTranslationText: Above	it	are	nineteen	guards.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	par	unnees	dārogha	haiñ

arabicText: وَمَا جَعَلْنَآ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَـٰٓئِكَةًۭ ۙ وَمَا جَعَلْنَا عِدَّتَهُمْ إِلَّا فِتْنَةًۭ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لِيَسْتَيْقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَيَزْدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِيمَـٰنًۭا ۙ وَلَا يَرْتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا۟ ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَٱلْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۙ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِى قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٌۭ وَٱلْكَـٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَـٰذَا مَثَلًۭا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهْدِى مَن يَشَآءُ ۚ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَ ۚ وَمَا هِىَ إِلَّا ذِكْرَىٰ لِلْبَشَرِ
englishTranslationText:
We	have	not	appointed	the	guards	of	hell,	
except	angels;	and	did	not	keep	this	
number	except	to	test	the	disbelievers	–	in	
order	that	the	People	given	the	Book(s)	
may	be	convinced,	and	to	increase	the	faith	
of	the	believers	–	and	so	that	the	People	
given	the	Book(s)	and	the	Muslims	may	not	
have	any	doubt	-	and	so	that	those	in	
whose	hearts	is	a	disease	and	the	
disbelievers,	may	say,	“What	does	Allah	
mean	by	this	amazing	example?”	This	is	
how	Allah	sends	astray	whomever	He	
wills,	and	guides	whomever	He	wills;	and	no	one	knows	the	armies	of	Allah	except	Him;	and	this	
is	not	but	an	advice	to	man.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	dozakh	ke	dārogha	na	kiye	
magar	Firishte	aur	ham	ne	unki	yeh	ginti	
na	rakhi	magar	kāfiroñ	ki	jāñch	ko	is	liye	ke	
Kitāb	waloñ	ko	yaqeen	āaye	aur	Imān	
waloñ		ka	imān	badhe	aur	kitāb	waloñ		aur	
Musalmanoñ		ko	koi	shak	na	rahe	aur	dil	ke	
rogi	aur	kāfir	kaheiñ	is	achambe	(T’ajjub)	
ki	bāt	meiñ	Allah	ka	kya	matlab	hai	yuñ	hi	
Allah	gumrah	karta	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	
hidāyat	farmāta	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	tumhāre	
Rab	ke	lashkaroñ	ko	uske	siwa	koi	nahi	
jānta	aur	woh	to	nahi	magar	āadmi	ke	liye	
nasihat

englishTranslationText: Yes,	never!*	By	oath	of	the	moon.	(Hell	will	never	spare	the	disbelievers).
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	hāñ	chāñd	ki	qasam

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	night	when	it	turns	back.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rāt	ki	jab	peeth	phere.

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	morning,	when	it	spreads	light.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	subah	ki	jab	ujāla	dāle.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	hell	is	one	of	the	greatest	entities.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	dozakh	bahut	badi cheezoñ	meiñ	ki	ek	hai.

englishTranslationText: Warn	the	men.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ādmiyoñ	ko	darāo

arabicText: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمْ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوْ يَتَأَخَّرَ
englishTranslationText: For	the	one	among	you	who	wishes	to	come	forward	or	stay	back.
romanUrduTranslationText: Usey	jo	tum	meiñ	chāhe	ke	āage	āaye	ya	peechhe	rahe

englishTranslationText: Every	soul	is	mortgaged	for	its	own	deeds.
romanUrduTranslationText: Har	jān	apni	karni	meiñ	girwi	hai.

englishTranslationText: Except	those	on	the	right	side.
romanUrduTranslationText: Magar	dehni	taraf	wāle

englishTranslationText: In	Gardens,	they	seek	answers,
romanUrduTranslationText: Bāghoñ	meiñ	poochhte	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: From	the	guilty.
romanUrduTranslationText: Bāghoñ	meiñ	poochhte	haiñ.

englishTranslationText: “What	took	you	into	the	hell?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Mujrimon	se.

englishTranslationText: They	said,	“We	never	used	to	offer	the	prayer.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumheiñ		kya	bāt	dozakh	meiñ	le gayi?

englishTranslationText: “Nor	used	to	feed	the	needy.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	bole	ham	Namāz	na	padhte	they.

englishTranslationText: “And	used	to	dwell	on	evil	matters	with	those	who	think	evilly.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	behooda	fikr	waloñ		ke	sāth	behooda	fikreiñ	karte	they.

englishTranslationText: “And	used	to	deny	the	Day	of	Justice.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ham	insāf	ke	din	ko	jhutlāte rahe.

englishTranslationText: “Till	death	overcame	us.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Yahāñ	tak	ke	hameiñ	maut	āayi

englishTranslationText:
“So	the	intercession	of	the	intercessors	will	
not	benefit	them.		
(The disbelievers will not have any 
intercessor.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unheiñ	sifārishyoñ	ki	sifārish kām	na	
degi

englishTranslationText:
So	what	is	the	matter	with	them	that	they	
turn	away	from	the	advice?
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unheiñ	kya	huwa	nasihat	se	moñh	
pherte	haiñ

englishTranslationText: As	if	they	were	startled	donkeys	-
romanUrduTranslationText: Goya	woh	bhadke	huwe	gadhe	hoñ.

englishTranslationText: Fleeing	away	from	a	lion.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	sher	se	bhāge	hoñ

arabicText: بَلْ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمْرِئٍۢ مِّنْهُمْ أَن يُؤْتَىٰ صُحُفًۭا مُّنَشَّرَةًۭ
englishTranslationText:
Rather	each	one	of	them	desires	that	he	
should	be	given	open	Books.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Balke	un	meiñ	ka	har	shakhs	chāhta	hai	ke	
khule	saheefe	uske	hāth	meiñ	de	diye	jāyeñ

englishTranslationText:
Never!	In	fact	they	do	not	fear	the	
Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hargiz	nahi	balke	unko	āakhirat	ka	dar	
nahi

englishTranslationText: Yes	indeed,	this	is	an	advice.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	hāñ	be-shak	woh	nasihat	hai.

englishTranslationText: So	whoever	wills	may	heed	advice	from	it
romanUrduTranslationText: To	jo	chāhe	us	se	nasihat	le.

arabicText: وَمَا يَذْكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ هُوَ أَهْلُ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ وَأَهْلُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ
englishTranslationText:
And	what	advice	will	they	heed,	except	if	
Allah	wills?	Only	He	deserves	to	be	feared,	
and	His	only	is	the	greatness	of	forgiving.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	kya	nasihat	māneiñ	magar	jab	
Allah	chāhe	wohi	hai	darne	ke	lāiq	aur	usi	
ki	shān	hai	maghfirat	farmāna.

englishTranslationText: I	swear	by	the	Day	of	Resurrection.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Roz-e-Qiyamat	ki	qasam	yād	farmāta	
hooñ.

englishTranslationText:
And	by	oath	of	the	soul	that	reproaches	
itself.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	jān	ki	qasam	jo	apne	ūpar	bahut	
malāmat	kare

englishTranslationText:
Does	man	assume	that	We	will	never	
assemble	his	bones?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	āadmi	yeh	samajhta	hai	ke ham	hargiz	
uski	haddiyañ	jam’a	na farmāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: بَلَىٰ قَـٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّىَ بَنَانَهُۥ
englishTranslationText:
Surely	yes,	why	not?	We	can	properly	
make	all	his	phalanxes.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyuñ	nahi	ham	qādir	haiñ	ke	uske	por	
theek	bana	deiñ

englishTranslationText: In	fact	man	wishes	to	commit	evil	in	front	of	Him!
romanUrduTranslationText: Balke	āadmi	chāhta	hai	ke	uski nigah	ke	sāmne	badi	kare

englishTranslationText: He	asks,	“When	will	be	the	Day	of	Resurrection?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Poochhta	hai	Qiyamat	ka	din	kab	hoga?

englishTranslationText: So	when	the	eyes	will	be	blinded	by	light.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	jis	din	āañkh	chondhyāye	gi

englishTranslationText: And	the	moon	will	be	eclipsed.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	chānd	gahega

englishTranslationText: And	the	sun	and	the	moon	will	be	united.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	sooraj	aur	chānd	milā	diye jāyeñ	ge

englishTranslationText: On	that	day	man	will	cry	out,	“Where	shall	I	flee?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	din	āadmi	kahega	kidhar bhāg	kar	jāoñ?

englishTranslationText: Never!	There	is	no	refuge!
romanUrduTranslationText: Hargiz	nahi	koi	panah	nahi

englishTranslationText: On	that	day,	the	destination	is	only	towards	your	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	din	tere	Rab	hi	ki	taraf	ja	kar	thaherna	hai

arabicText: يُنَبَّؤُا۟ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
englishTranslationText: On	that	day,	man	will	be	informed	of	all	what	he	sent	ahead	and	left	behind.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	din	ādmi	ko	uska	sab	agla	pichla	jatā	diya	jāyega

englishTranslationText: In	fact,	man	himself	is	keeping	an	eye	on	his	state	of	affairs!
romanUrduTranslationText: Balke	ādmi	khud	hi	apne	hāl	par	poori	nigah	rakhta	hai.

englishTranslationText: And	even	if	he	presents	all	the	excuses	he	has,	none	will	be	listened	to.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	agar	uske	pās	jitne	bahāne	hoñ	sab	la	dāle

arabicText: لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِۦٓ
englishTranslationText:
O	dear	Prophet	(Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	do	not	cause	your	tongue	to	
move	along	with	the	Qur’an	in	order	to	learn	it	faster.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	bhi	na	suna	jāyega	tum	yād	karne	ki	jaldi	meiñ	Qur’ān	ke	sāth apni	zubān	ko	harkat	na	do

englishTranslationText: Indeed	assembling	the	Qur’an	and	reading	it	are	upon	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	uska	mehfooz	karna	aur padhna

englishTranslationText: So	when	We	have	read	it,	you	should	thereupon	follow	what	is	read.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hamāre	zimme	hai	to	jab	ham	usey	pardh	chukeiñ	us	waqt	us	pardhe	huwe	ki	itteba	karo

englishTranslationText: Then	indeed,	to	explain	its	details	to	you	is	upon	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	be-shak	uski	bāreekiyoñ	ka	tum	par	zāhir	farmāna	hamāre	zimme	hai.

englishTranslationText:
None	except	you,	O	disbelievers	–	you	love	
what	you	have,	the	fleeting	one.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Koi	nahi	balke	aey	kāfiro	tum	pāoñ	tale	ki	
dost	rakhte	ho

englishTranslationText: And	you	have	forsaken	the	Hereafter.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	āakhirat	ko	chhode	baithe	ho.

englishTranslationText:
On	that	day,	some	faces	will	shine	with	
freshness.
romanUrduTranslationText: Kuch	muñh	us	din	tar-o-tāza hoñge

englishTranslationText: Looking	towards	their	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: Apne	Rab	ko	dekhte

englishTranslationText: And	on	that	day	some	faces	will	be	ghastly.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kuch	muñh	us	din	bigrde	huwe	hoñge

englishTranslationText:
Knowing	that	they	will	be	subjected	to	a	
torment	that	breaks	the	backs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Samajhte	hoñge	ke	unke	sāth	woh	ki	jāye	
gi	jo	kamar	ko	tod	de

englishTranslationText:
Yes	indeed,	when	the	soul	will	reach	up	to	
the	throat.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	hāñ	jab	jān	gale	ko	pahuñch	jāye	gi

englishTranslationText:
And	they	will	say,	“Is	there	any	one	–	any	
magician?”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur log kaheñ	ge	ke	hai	koi	jhārd	phooñk	
kare

englishTranslationText: And	he	will	realise	that	this	is	the	parting.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	samajh	lega	ke	yeh	judayi	ki	ghadi	
hai

englishTranslationText:
And	one	shin	will	curl	up	with	the	other	
shin.	.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	pindli	se	pindli	lipat	jāye	gi

englishTranslationText:
On	that	day,	the	herding	will	be	only	
towards	your	Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	din	tere	Rab	hi	ki	taraf	hāñkna	hai

englishTranslationText:
Neither	did	he	believe	it	to	be	true,	nor	did	
he	offer	the	prayer.
romanUrduTranslationText: Usne	na	to	sach	māna	aur	na	namāz	padhi.

englishTranslationText: But	he	denied	and	turned	away.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hāñ	jhutlāya	aur	muñh	phera

englishTranslationText: Then	he	went	back	to	his	home	in	pride.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	apne	ghar	ko	akadta	chala

englishTranslationText: Your	ruin	has	come	close,	still	closer.
romanUrduTranslationText: Teri	kharābi	āa	lagi	ab	āa	lagi.

englishTranslationText: Again	your	ruin	has	come	close,	still	closer.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	teri	kharābi	āa	lagi	ab	āa	lagi

englishTranslationText: Does	man	assume	that	he	will	be	let	loose?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	āadmi	is	ghamand	meiñ	hai	ke	āazād	
chhod	diya	jāyega

arabicText: أَلَمْ يَكُ نُطْفَةًۭ مِّن مَّنِىٍّۢ يُمْنَىٰ
englishTranslationText:
Was	he	not	just	a	drop	of	the	semen	that	is	
discharged?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kya	woh	ek	booñd	na	tha	us	mani	ka	ke	
girayi	jāye

englishTranslationText: He	then	became	a	clot	–	so	Allah	created	him,	then	made	him	proper.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	khooñ	ki	phutak	huwa	to	usne	paida	
farmāya	phir	theek	banāya

englishTranslationText: So	created	from	him	a	pair,	the	male	and	female
romanUrduTranslationText: To	us	se	do	jod	banāaye	mard aur	aurat.

arabicText: أَلَيْسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَـٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحْـِۧىَ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ
englishTranslationText: So	will	He,	Who	has	done	all	this,	not	be	able	to	revive	the	dead?
romanUrduTranslationText: Kya	jisne	yeh	kuchh	kiya	woh	murde	na	jila	sakega?

arabicText: هَلْ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْإِنسَـٰنِ حِينٌۭ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهْرِ لَمْ يَكُن شَيْـًۭٔا مَّذْكُورًا
englishTranslationText: Indeed	there	has	been	a	time	for	man,	when	even	his	name	did	not	exist	anywhere
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	āadmi	par	ek	waqt	woh	guzra	ke	kahiñ	uska	nām	bhi	na	tha

arabicText: إِنَّا خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ مِن نُّطْفَةٍ أَمْشَاجٍۢ نَّبْتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ سَمِيعًۢا بَصِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	We	have	created	man	from	mixed	semen;	in	order	to	test	him	–	We	therefore	made	
hearing,	seeing.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	ham	ne	āadmi	ko	paida	kiya	mili	huyi	mani	se	ke	usey	jāñche	to	usey	sunta	dekhta	
kar	diya

arabicText: إِنَّا هَدَيْنَـٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرًۭا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا
englishTranslationText: We	have	indeed	shown	him	the	way	-	whether	he	is	grateful	or	ingrate.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	ham	ne	usey	rāh	batāyi	ya	haq	mānta	ya	na-shukri	karta

arabicText: إِنَّآ أَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكَـٰفِرِينَ سَلَـٰسِلَا۟ وَأَغْلَـٰلًۭا وَسَعِيرًا
englishTranslationText: We	have	indeed	kept	prepared	chains,	and	shackles	and	a	blazing	fire	for	the	disbelievers.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	ham	ne	kāfiroñ		ke	liye	tayyār	kar	rakhi	haiñ	zanjeereiñ	aur	tauq	aur	bhadakti	āag

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلْأَبْرَارَ يَشْرَبُونَ مِن كَأْسٍۢ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
englishTranslationText: Indeed	the	virtuous	will	drink	from	a	cup,	containing	a	mixture	of	Kafoor.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	nek	peeyeñ	ge	us	jām	meiñ	se	jiski	malauni	(āamezish)	kāfoor	hai,	woh	kāfoor	kya?

arabicText: عَيْنًۭا يَشْرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفْجِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
The	Kafoor	is	a	spring,	from	which	the	
chosen	bondmen	of	Allah	will	drink,	
causing	it	to	flow	wherever	they	wish	
inside	their	palaces.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ek	chashma	hai	jis	meiñ	se	Allah	ke	nihayat	
khās	bande	peeyeñ	ge	apne	mehloñ	meiñ	
usey	jahāñ	chāheñ	baha	kar	le	jāyeñ	ge

arabicText: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذْرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوْمًۭا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسْتَطِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
They	fulfil	their	pledges,	and	fear	a	day	the	
evil	of	which	is	widespread.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apni	minnateiñ	poori	karte	haiñ	aur	us	din	
se	darte	haiñ	jiski	burāyi	phaili	huwi	hai

arabicText: وَيُطْعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسْكِينًۭا وَيَتِيمًۭا وَأَسِيرًا
englishTranslationText:
And	out	of	His	love,	they	give	food	to	the	
needy,	the	orphan	and	the	prisoner.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	khāna	khilāte	haiñ	uski	mahabbat	par	
miskeen	aur	yateem	aur	aseer	(Qaidi)	ko

arabicText: إِنَّمَا نُطْعِمُكُمْ لِوَجْهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمْ جَزَآءًۭ وَلَا شُكُورًا
englishTranslationText:
They	say	to	them,	“We	give	you	food,	only	
for	the	sake	of	Allah	-	we	do	not	seek	any	
reward	or	thanks	from	you.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unse	kehte	haiñ	ham	tumheiñ		khās	Allah	
ke	liye	khāna	dete	haiñ	tum	se	koi	badla	ya	
shukr	guzāri	nahi	māñgte.

arabicText: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوْمًا عَبُوسًۭا قَمْطَرِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
“Indeed	we	fear	from	our	Lord	a	day	which	
is	extremely	bitter,	most	severe.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		hameiñ	apne	Rab	se	ek	aise	din	ka	
dar	hai	jo	bahut	tursh	nihāyat	sakht	hai

arabicText: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلْيَوْمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمْ نَضْرَةًۭ وَسُرُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
So	Allah	saved	them	from	the	evil	of	that	
day,	and	gave	them	freshness	and	joy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unheiñ	Allah	ne	us	din	ke	shar	se	bachā	
liya	aur	unheiñ	tāzgi	aur	shādmāni	di.

englishTranslationText:
And	gave	them	Paradise	and	silk	clothes,	as	
a	reward	for	their	patience.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unke	sabr	par	unheiñ	Jannat	aur	
reshmi	kapde	sile	meiñ	diye.

arabicText: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلْأَرَآئِكِ ۖ لَا يَرَوْنَ فِيهَا شَمْسًۭا وَلَا زَمْهَرِيرًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Reclining	in	it,	upon	thrones;	they	will	not	
see	the	hot	sunshine	in	it,	nor	the	bitter	
cold.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jannat	meiñ	takhtoñ	par	takiya	lagaye	
hoñge	na	us	meiñ	dhoop	dekheiñ	ge	na	
thithar

arabicText: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيْهِمْ ظِلَـٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتْ قُطُوفُهَا تَذْلِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	its	shade	will	cover	them,	and	its	fruit	
clusters	brought	down	low	for	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	uske	sāaye	un	par	jhuke	hoñge	aur	
uske	guchchhe	jhuka	kar	neeche	kar	diye	
gaye	hoñge

arabicText: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيْهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٍۢ مِّن فِضَّةٍۢ وَأَكْوَابٍۢ كَانَتْ قَوَارِيرَا۠
englishTranslationText:
Rounds	of	silver	cups	and	silver	beakers,	
looking	like	glass,	will	be	presented	upon	
them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	par	chāñdi	ke	bartanoñ	aur	koozoñ	
ka	daur	hoga	jo	sheeshe	ke	misl	ho	rahe	
hoñge.

englishTranslationText:
Glass	made	from	silver,	which	the	servers	
have	filled	up	to	the	measure.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kaise	sheeshe	chāñdi	ke	sāqiyoñ	ne	unheiñ	
poore	andāze	par	rakha	hoga

arabicText: وَيُسْقَوْنَ فِيهَا كَأْسًۭا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
And	in	Paradise	they	will	be	given	to	drink	
cups,	filled	with	a	mixture	of	ginger.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	us	meiñ	woh	jām	pilaye	jāyeñ	ge	jiski	
milauni	adrak	hogi

englishTranslationText: Which	is	a	spring	in	Paradise	called	Salsabeel.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	adrak	kya	hai,	jannat	meiñ	ek	chashma	hai	jise	salsabeel	kehte	haiñ

arabicText: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيْهِمْ وِلْدَٰنٌۭ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيْتَهُمْ حَسِبْتَهُمْ لُؤْلُؤًۭا مَّنثُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Immortal	boys	shall	surround	them,	waiting	upon	them;	when	you	see	them,	you	would	think	
they	are	scattered	pearls.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unke	āas	pās	khidmat	meiñ	phireñ	ge	hamesha	rehne	wāle	ladke	jab	tu	unheiñ	dekhe	to	
unheiñ	samjhe	ke	moti	haiñ	bikhere	huwe

arabicText: وَإِذَا رَأَيْتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيْتَ نَعِيمًۭا وَمُلْكًۭا كَبِيرًا
englishTranslationText: And	when	you	look	towards	it,	you	will	see	serenity	and	a	great	kingdom.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	tu	idhar	nazar	uthāye	ek	chain	dekhe	aur	badi	saltanat

arabicText: عَـٰلِيَهُمْ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضْرٌۭ وَإِسْتَبْرَقٌۭ ۖ وَحُلُّوٓا۟ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٍۢ وَسَقَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ شَرَابًۭا طَهُورًا
englishTranslationText:
In	it	they	adorn	clothes	of	fine	green	silk	and	gold	embroidery;	and	they	are	given	silver	bracelets	
to	wear;	and	their	Lord	gave	them	pure	wine	to	drink.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Unke	badan	par	haiñ	kareb	ke	sabz	kaprde	aur	kanādeez	ke	aur	unheiñ	chāñdi	ke	kangan	pehnāye	
gaye	aur	unheiñ	unke	Rab	ne	suthri	sharāb	pilayi

arabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمْ جَزَآءًۭ وَكَانَ سَعْيُكُم مَّشْكُورًا
englishTranslationText: It	will	be	said	to	them,	“This	is	your	reward	–	indeed	your	efforts	have	been	appreciated.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Unse	farmāya	jāyega	yeh	tumhāra	sila	hai	aur	tumhāri	mehnat	thikāne	lagi

arabicText: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نَزَّلْنَا عَلَيْكَ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ تَنزِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText: Indeed	We	have	sent	down	the	Qur’an	upon	you,	in	stages.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak		ham	ne	tum	par	Qur’ān	ba-tadreej	utāra

arabicText: فَٱصْبِرْ لِحُكْمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعْ مِنْهُمْ ءَاثِمًا أَوْ كَفُورًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	stay	patient	upon	your	Lord’s	command,	and	do	not	listen	to	any	of	the	sinners	or	
ingrates	among	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	Rab	ke	ḥukm		par	sābir	raho	aur	in	meiñ	kisi	guneh-gār	ya	na-shukre	ki	bāt	na	suno

englishTranslationText: And	remember	the	name	of	your	Lord	morning	and	evening.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	apne	Rab	ka	subah-wa-shām	yād	karo

arabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَٱسْجُدْ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحْهُ لَيْلًۭا طَوِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
And	prostrate	for	Him	in	a	part	of	the	night,	
and	proclaim	His	purity	into	the	long	night.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kuch	rāt	meiñ	usey	sajda	karo	aur	badi	
rāt	tak	uski	pāki	bolo

arabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلْعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمْ يَوْمًۭا ثَقِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	these	people	love	what	they	have,	
the	fleeting	one,	and	have	forsaken	the	
immensely	important	day	behind	them.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		yeh	log	pāoñ	tale	ki	azeez	rakhte	
haiñ	aur	apne	peechhe	ek	bhāri	din	ko	
chord	baithe	haiñ

arabicText: نَّحْنُ خَلَقْنَـٰهُمْ وَشَدَدْنَآ أَسْرَهُمْ ۖ وَإِذَا شِئْنَا بَدَّلْنَآ أَمْثَـٰلَهُمْ تَبْدِيلًا
englishTranslationText:
It	is	We	Who	created	them,	and	
strengthened	their	skeleton;	and	We	can	
replace	them	with	others	like	them,	
whenever	We	will.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	ne	unheiñ	paida	kiya	aur	unke	jord	
band	mazboot	kiye	aur	ham	jab	chāheñ	un	
jaise	aur	badal	deiñ

arabicText: إِنَّ هَـٰذِهِۦ تَذْكِرَةٌۭ ۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًۭا
englishTranslationText:
This	is	indeed	an	advice;	so	whoever	
wishes	may	take	the	path	towards	his	
Lord.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		yeh	nasihat	hai	to	jo	chāhe	apne	
Rab	ki	taraf	rāh	le

arabicText: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمًۭا
englishTranslationText:
And	what	will	you	wish,	except	if	Allah	
wills;	indeed	Allah	is	All	Knowing,	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tum	kya	chāho	magar	yeh	ke	Allah	
chāhe	be-shak	woh	Ilm-o	Hikmat	wāla	hai

arabicText: يُدْخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِى رَحْمَتِهِۦ ۚ وَٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمْ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًۢا
englishTranslationText:
He	admits	into	His	mercy,	whomever	He	
wills;	and	for	the	unjust	He	has	kept	
prepared	a	painful	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apni	Raḥmat	meiñ	leta	hai	jise	chāhe	aur	
zālimoñ	ke	liye	usne	dard-nāk	‘aƶāb		tayyār	
kar	rakha	hai.

englishTranslationText:
By	oath	of	those	that	are	sent,	one	after	the	
other*.	(*The	verses	of	the	Holy	Qur’an	or	the	
angels	or	the	winds).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Qasam	unki	jo	bheji	jāti	haiñ	laga-tār*.	
(*Qur’an-e-Kareem	ki	Āyāt,	Firishte	ya	
hawaein).

englishTranslationText:
Then	by	oath	of	those	that	push	with	a	
strong	gust.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	zor	se	jhoñka	dene	wāliyañ.

englishTranslationText: Then	by	oath	of	those	that	lift	and	carry.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	ubhār kar	uthāne	wāliyañ

englishTranslationText: Then	by	those	that	clearly	differentiate	the	right	and	wrong.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Phir	haq	na-haq	ko	khoob	juda	karne	
wāliyañ

englishTranslationText: And	then	by	those	that	instil	Remembrance	into	the	hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	unki	qasam	jo	zikr	ka	ilqa	karti	haiñ

englishTranslationText: To	complete	the	argument	or	to	warn.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hujjat	tamām	karne	ya	darāne	ko.

englishTranslationText: Indeed	what	you	are	promised,	will	surely	befall.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	jis	bāt	ka	tum	w’ada	diye jāte	ho

englishTranslationText: So	when	the	lights	of	the	stars	are	put	out.
romanUrduTranslationText: Zaroor	honi	hai	phir	jab	tāre	mahv kar	diye	jāyeñ

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	sky	is	split	apart.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	āasmān	meiñ	rakhne	padeiñ

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	mountains	are	made	into	dust	and	blown	away.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	pahārd	ghubār	karke	uda	diye	jāyeñ.

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	time	of	the	Noble	Messengers	arrives.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	Rasooloñ	ka	waqt	āaye
